TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListView/ColumnHeaderCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList

Docs.summary: Represents the collection of column headers in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection> class stores the column headers that are displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.View%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.View.Details>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection> stores <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> objects that define the text to display for a column as well as how the column header is displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control when displaying columns. When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> displays columns, the items and their subitems are displayed in their own columns. To specify which columns subitem data is displayed under, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection> class.
There are a number of ways to add column headers to the collection. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method adds a single column header to the collection. To add a number of column headers to the collection, you create an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> objects and pass it to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method. If you want to insert a column header at a specific location in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Insert%2A> method. To remove column headers, you can use either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Remove%2A> method or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method if you know where the column header is located in the collection. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Clear%2A> method allows you to remove all column headers from the collection instead of using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a single column header at a time.
In addition to methods and properties for adding and removing column headers, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection> also provides methods to find column headers in the collection. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether a column header is a member of the collection. Once you know that the column header is located in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine where the column header is located in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > Unexpected behavior can result when the combined width of all columns exceeds 32,768 pixels.
## Examples The following code example creates a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control that manually sorts items when a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control is clicked. The example defines a class called `ListViewItemComparer` that implements the <xref:System.Collections.IComparer?displayProperty=fullName> interface that performs the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> comparison. The example creates an instance of `ListViewItemComparer` and uses it to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemSorter%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Sort%2A> method call in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnClick> event handler uses the methods defined in `ListViewItemComparer` to perform the sort of items, based on the column that is clicked.
[!code-cpp[ListView.ColumnClick#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListView.ColumnClick/CPP/listviewsort1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[ListView.ColumnClick#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListView.ColumnClick/CS/listviewsort1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ListView.ColumnClick#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListView.ColumnClick/VB/listviewsort1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int Add (System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 Add(class System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader value) cil managed

Docs.param: The to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds an existing to the collection.
Docs.returns: The zero-based index into the collection where the item was added.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method to add an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> to the collection. If you want to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> at the time you add it to the collection, you can use the other version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method.
When column headers are added, they are added to the end of the collection. To insert a column header into the collection at a specific position, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Insert%2A> method. To add a set of column headers to the collection in a single operation, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example creates a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control that manually sorts items when a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control is clicked. The example defines a class called `ListViewItemComparer` that implements the <xref:System.Collections.IComparer?displayProperty=fullName> interface that performs the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> comparison. The example creates an instance of `ListViewItemComparer` and uses it to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemSorter%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Sort%2A> method call in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnClick> event handler uses the methods defined in `ListViewItemComparer` to perform the sort of items, based on the column that is clicked.
[!code-cpp[ListView.ColumnClick#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListView.ColumnClick/CPP/listviewsort1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[ListView.ColumnClick#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListView.ColumnClick/CS/listviewsort1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ListView.ColumnClick#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListView.ColumnClick/VB/listviewsort1.vb#1)]

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader Add(string text, int32 width, valuetype System.Windows.Forms.HorizontalAlignment textAlign) cil managed

Docs.param: The text to display in the column header.
The initial width of the column header.
One of the values.
Docs.summary: Adds a column header to the collection with specified text, width, and alignment settings.
Docs.returns: The that was created and added to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> to add to the collection. The text of the new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> added to the control is based on the `text` parameter. This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method also allows you to specify the width of the column and the alignment of text in the column header. If you have an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> that you want to add to the collection, use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method that accepts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> as its parameter.
When column headers are added, they are added to the end of the collection. To insert a column header into the collection at a specific position, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Insert%2A> method. To add a set of column headers to the collection in a single operation, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control with three <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> objects specified and three <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects specified for each item. The example also creates <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> objects to display the subitems in details view. Two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> objects are also created in the code example to provide images for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> objects. These <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> objects are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.LargeImageList%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SmallImageList%2A> properties. The example uses the following properties in creating the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control:
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.View%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.LabelEdit%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AllowColumnReorder%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckBoxes%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.FullRowSelect%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.GridLines%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Sorting%2A>
This example requires that you have added the code to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> and call the method created in the example from the constructor or another method on the form. The example also requires that images named `MySmallImage1`, `MySmallImage2`, `MyLargeImage1`, and `MyLargeImage2` are located in the root directory of drive C.
[!code-cpp[ListViewExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListViewExample/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[ListViewExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListViewExample/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ListViewExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ListViewExample/VB/form1.vb#1)]

If you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property enables you to determine the number of columns that are displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.View%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.View.Details>. You can then use this value when you are looping through the values of the collection and you need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop.

MemberSignature.Value: public int IndexOf (System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader value);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOf(class System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader value) cil managed

Docs.param: A representing the column header to locate in the collection.
Docs.summary: Returns the index, within the collection, of the specified column header.
Docs.returns: The zero-based index of the column header's location in the collection. If the column header is not located in the collection, the return value is -1.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.IndexOf%2A> method enables you to determine the position of a column header in the collection. To determine whether a column header is contained in the collection before calling this method, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Contains%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int IndexOfKey (string key);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 IndexOfKey(string key) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the column to retrieve the index for.
Docs.summary: Determines the index for a column with the specified key.
Docs.returns: The zero-based index for the first occurrence of the column with the specified name, if found; otherwise, -1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The key comparison is not case-sensitive. If `key` is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1`.`
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.

You can use this method if you want to insert a new column header into an existing collection of column headers. remarks.format:
## Remarks To add a column header without specifying a position in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method. If you want to add an array of column headers to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsReadOnly { get; }
.property instance bool IsReadOnly

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
Docs.value: if the collection is read-only; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is always `false` for this collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader this[int index] { get; }
.property instance class System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader Item(int32)

Docs.param: The index of the column header to retrieve from the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets the column header at the specified index within the collection.
Docs.value: A representing the column header located at the specified index within the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this method to obtain the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> stored at a specific location in the collection. To determine the index of a specific column header in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.

Docs.exception: is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader this[string key] { get; }
.property instance class System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader Item(string)

Docs.param: The name of the column header to retrieve from the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets the column header with the specified key from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The key comparison is not case-sensitive. If `key` is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Item%2A> returns `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Remove (System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader column);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Remove(class System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader column) cil managed

Docs.param: A representing the column header to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the specified column header from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you remove a column header from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent column headers in the collection. All information about the removed column header is deleted. You can use this method to remove a specific column header from the collection by specifying the actual <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader> to remove. To specify the index of the column header to remove instead of the column header itself, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method. To remove all column headers from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Clear%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void RemoveAt (int index);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RemoveAt(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the column header to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes the column header at the specified index within the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you remove a column header from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent column headers in the collection. All information about the removed column header is deleted. You can use this method to remove a specific column header from the collection by specifying the index of the column header to remove from the collection. To specify the column header to remove instead of the index to the column header, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Remove%2A> method. To remove all column headers from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.Clear%2A> method.

Docs.exception: is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RemoveByKey(string key) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the column to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the column with the specified key from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnHeader.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a column in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection>.
The key comparison is not-case sensitive. If `key` is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection.RemoveByKey%2A> does not change the collection`.`
